metadata.title: CVE-2019-7175 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
In ImageMagick before 7.0.8-25, some memory leaks exist in DecodeImage incoders/pcd.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7175` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm10
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm10
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm10
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm10
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm10
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm10
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm10').
